Package com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl

Class SoftWrapModelImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.editor.InlayModel.SimpleAdapter
      • com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl.SoftWrapModelImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dumpable, Disposable, DocumentListener, FoldingListener, PrioritizedDocumentListener, SoftWrapModelEx, InlayModel.Listener, SoftWrapModel, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class SoftWrapModelImpl
extends InlayModel.SimpleAdapter
implements SoftWrapModelEx, PrioritizedDocumentListener, FoldingListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, Dumpable, Disposable
    Default SoftWrapModelEx implementation.

    Works as a mix of GoF Facade and Bridge, i.e. delegates the processing to the target sub-components and provides utility methods built on top of sub-components API.

    Not thread-safe.

    • Method Detail

      • reinitSettings

        public void reinitSettings()
        Called on editor settings change. Current model is expected to drop all cached information about the settings if any.

      • isRespectAdditionalColumns

        public boolean isRespectAdditionalColumns()
        Description copied from interface: SoftWrapModelEx
        IJ editor defines a notion of additional columns. They define additional amount of space to be used during editor component's width calculation (IJ editor perform 'preventive UI component expansion' when user types near the right edge).

        The main idea of soft wraps is to avoid horizontal scrolling, so, when soft wrapping is enabled and succeeds (so that resulting text layout fits view area's width), additional columns wont be added to the preferred editor width. This method answers whether the above behaviour should be overridden, and additional columns setting should be respected regardless of soft wrapping success. This happens when SoftWrapModelEx.forceAdditionalColumnsUsage() has been invoked previously.

        Specified by:
        isRespectAdditionalColumns in interface SoftWrapModelEx

      • forceAdditionalColumnsUsage

        public void forceAdditionalColumnsUsage()
        Description copied from interface: SoftWrapModelEx
        Allows to instruct current model to return 'true' from SoftWrapModelEx.isRespectAdditionalColumns().
        Specified by:

      • getSoftWrapIndex

        public int getSoftWrapIndex(int offset)
        Description copied from interface: SoftWrapModelEx
        Tries to find index of the target soft wrap at soft wraps collection. 'Target' soft wrap is the one that starts at the given offset.
        Specified by:
        getSoftWrapIndex in interface SoftWrapModelEx
        Parameters:
        offset - target offset
        Returns:
        index that conforms to Collections.binarySearch(List, Object) contract, i.e. non-negative returned index points to soft wrap that starts at the given offset; '-(negative value) - 1' points to position at soft wraps collection where soft wrap for the given index should be inserted

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible(SoftWrap softWrap)
        Description copied from interface: SoftWrapModel
        Allows to answer if given soft wrap is shown.

        The soft wrap may be not shown if it's located, for example, inside collapsed folding region.

        Specified by:
        isVisible in interface SoftWrapModel

      • prepareToMapping

        public void prepareToMapping()
        Encapsulates preparations for performing document dimension mapping (e.g. visual to logical position) and answers if soft wraps-aware processing should be used (e.g. there is no need to consider soft wraps if user configured them not to be used).

      • beforeDocumentChangeAtCaret

        public void beforeDocumentChangeAtCaret()
        Description copied from interface: SoftWrapModel
        Notifies current model that target document is about to be changed at current caret location.

        Primary purpose of this method is to perform 'soft wrap' -> 'hard wrap' conversion if the user types in virtual soft wraps-introduced space.

        Specified by:
        beforeDocumentChangeAtCaret in interface SoftWrapModel

      • onFoldRegionStateChange

        public void onFoldRegionStateChange(FoldRegion region)
        Description copied from interface: FoldingListener
        Informs that 'collapsed' state of given fold region is just changed, or that the given fold region has just been created.

        Note: listener should delay fold region state processing until FoldingListener.onFoldProcessingEnd() is called. I.e. folding model may return inconsistent data between current moment and FoldingListener.onFoldProcessingEnd().

        Specified by:
        onFoldRegionStateChange in interface FoldingListener
        Parameters:
        region - fold region that is just collapsed or expanded
